content.description:
Climbs the striking ramp feature to the upper ridge. Feels like an alpine trad line with some bolts. From the top of House Mountain, scramble up for around 50 minutes. Big, loose scree. Stay to the left and cross once near the wall.

P1: Start at the flagging tape on the tree and up the bulge to single bolt belay on ledge. 5.5 50m

P2: Up amazing chert past bolts and right to ledge. 5.5 40m

P3: Straight up and left to a ramp with piton belay. 5.5 30m

P4: Up right past bolts on fun slab and then straight up and right to small ledge and single bolt belay. 5.8 60m

P5: Up hollow flakes past bolt and up left then right to top. 5.8 60m

Descent: Hike west up to small summit and down ridge. Follow your nose. Maybe a few tree rappels. Gain descent trail from Rundlehorn area.



Directly above House Mountain.

Single rack, 12 draws, 60m rope

A steep cave with 6 sport climbs 100 m right of the start of Yonge Street. Right to Left

Dog and Toque 5.9 FA Marina Nelson

Moscow Mule 5.11a FA B Pullan

Happy Hour 5.11b FA B Pullan / J Nowakowski

Heart Breaker 5.12a FA Brett Harrington

Blue Curacao (Fire Ball) 5.13b FA Zach Watson

Cabeza Grande 5.12? 


10 QD 60m rope

Gear: One 60m rope, single rack, 12 quickdraws, helmetPitches one to six: Follow slabs and grooves and some OK rock. Belay off single bolts, slabs are bolted (3rd class to 5.5, 180m)Find the single bolt above the large gully, below a cornerPitch seven: Move up and right to splitter corner (good big cams) to a bolt. Move left on big holds to ledge (5.7, 30m)Pitch eight: Move right up a slab past a crack (spot the bolt) and up the groove and slab back left (5.6, 30m)Pitch nine: Up right through a groove and continue past right-facing cracks and up to ledge (5.6, 30m)Pitch 10: Move right on slabs, passing cracks and spaced bolts. Fixed nut in corner, end on ledge (5.6, 30m)Pitch 11: Head up left on easy terrain to base of corner (4th class, 30m)Pitch 12: Head straight up the right-facing corner and move right onto slab. Back left to top (5.8, 30m)Descent: Rappel six pitches to treed ledge. Walk into the forest east of the climb and descend down mossy trees.



 From the parking for Yonge Street, head straight up to the wall above. Stay to the right in the trees. Cut left to the lowest rock below the slabs. 

Single rack, 14 draws, 60m rope

Up a drainage feature. Not that great but accesses scree slope and upper route After the Gold Rush. Crag to the right is from the 1990s, great climbs by Peter Arbic and friends. Pitch one: Up the white slab using the left corner (5.8, 30m)Pitch two: Up left through a groove and slab (5.7, 30m)Pitch three: Up the scree/slab (3rd class, 30m)Pitch four: Up the rib left of the gully to a ridge (5.5, 30m)Pitch five: Continue up rib past bushes (5.3, 30m)Pitch six: Through the trees to a short wall (3rd class, 30m)Pitch seven: Up the wall to easier slabs above (5.6, 25m) Rappel  Approach: Park at the fifth tee at the golf course on the opposite side of the road in a small pullout. Hike down the road for 50 metres to flagging tape. Head up.

Gear: One 60m rope, helmet, 12 quickdraws

Fun climb. Mellow lower slabs after quick approach. Low angle middle leads to a fun finish up cruisy (sometimes loose) rock to the top of the wall. Pitch one: Up left on solid slab and right to small ledge (5.7, 15m)Pitch two: Through notch and slab to below roof (5.6, 15m)Pitch three: Jam the crack right and follow a vegetated ramp to ledge (5.6, 30m)Tent Peg Variation: Move left and up flake to crack and slab (5.8, 30m) *Watch for the tent peg in a crack before ledge*Pitch four: Follow rib to below upper slope (5.3, 30m)Pitch five: Up slabs to ledge (5.2, 30m)Pitch six: Up right past bulge and rib, avoid scree (5.3, 30m)Pitch seven: Up left across scree, find bolts on solid rock to below groove (5.3, 30m)Pitch eight: Up the groove with a funky move mid-way (5.6, 30m)Pitch nine: Up vegetation past tree, right up slab (5.6, 30m)Pitch 10: Move left up small wall with a rock-over move, follow up arete (5.8, 30m)Pitch 11: The S-pitch – Tricky slab up right, then left and back right (5.7, 30m)Pitch 12: Up right past a big solid block with a tricky move to arete, move left past loose ground (5.8, 30m)Pitch 13: Through trees to mossy groove, enough clean rock to get up (5.7, 30m)Pitch 14: Up ramp to right and back left to top of wall (5.5, 30m) Approach: Park at a small pullout on the right about 200 metres past the fifth tee here. Walk back down the road 100m to flagging tape. Follow up to scree and base of pitch one.

Gear: One 60m rope, helmet, 14 quickdraws
North facing multi-pitch rock routes over the Banff golf course. Rock is OK, position and views are great. Approaches are 15 to 30 minutes.
